content.description: The graph above shows the radioactive decay of Cesium-<math alttext="137" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>137</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> that was produced in a power plant in 2011.
content.question: Which of the following can be determined from the data in the graph?

choices.label: The year when the power plant started producing electricity
The total number of kilowatts that can be produced per year
The year when Cesium-<math alttext="137" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> can be disposed of safely
The amount of Cesium-<math alttext="137" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> needed to produce electricity

content.answer: The year when Cesium-<math alttext="137" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>137</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> can be disposed of safely

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
